alt: A headshot of Leah, a white woman with brown shoulder-length hair and wearing a cream-colored sweater.
name: Leah Findlater
bio: Leah is an associate professor in Human Centered Design and Engineering at the University of Washington. She is also an adjunct associate professor in Computer Science and Engineering, an affiliate professor in Disability Studies, and an associate director of UW CREATE (Center for Research and Education on Accessible Technology and Experiences).

alt: A head shot of Lotus, a Chinese woman with long black hair and round glasses, wearing a black jacket and a sky blue t-shirt, smiling in front of a big cherry blossom tree with green leaves
name: Lotus Zhang
bio: Lotus is a 5th year PhD candidate in HCDE. She conducts HCI and accessibility research with a focus on supporting creative pursuits and leisure of people with different abilities through design.

alt: A head shot of Lucy, a Chinese American woman with long black hair, smiling in front of light pink cherry blossom trees. She wears a denim jacket, hoop earrings, and a necklace.
name: Lucy Jiang
bio: Lucy is currently a Master's student at Cornell University. Her research focuses on subjective media accessibility (e.g., videos, images, art) and disability representation.

alt: A head shot of Avery, a white, femme-presenting person with light brown hair shaved short on one side, smiling. They are wearing a grey shrit and green blazer
name: Avery Mack
bio: Avery is currently a postdoctoral research in Human Centered Design and Engineering. Their research focuses on mitigating disability bias in generative AI models.

alt: Emma, a white woman with short red hair and round black glasses, sits near the water, wearing a light purple blazer over a black tank top, smiling, not looking directly at the camera
name: Emma McDonnell
bio: Emma is a 5th year PhD candidate in Human Centered Design and Engineering. Her research explores how to design communication technologies that foster collective access.
